channel.title: Home on Fishy Data
channel.description: Recent content in Home on Fishy Data

item.title: Pushing like a dream with git alias
item.description: For years I have staged, committed and pushed changes with the RStudio Git interface. It works! But it can be time-consuming when you are doing it a lot. And I’ve been trying to use my mouse less. It would be better to do this in the terminal. I found this solution on stackoverflow, which suggests staging and committing all files by running the following in the terminal: git add -A && git commit -m "rebuild site" We can push like this:

item.title: About
item.description: Hi ðŸ‘‹ I’m Seb Dalgarno. This is my blog for all things R, fish movement, statistics, data visualization, and various other data/computery things. I’m a PhD student at the UNBC Freshwater Fish Ecology lab. We are using many years of acoustic telemetry data and Bayesian models to make inferences about White Sturgeon movement in the Columbia River. Formerly, I was a computational biologist at Poisson Consulting. Check out my personal or consulting website for more info.
